title: 113_s1268
content: Approval of the agreement between the United States and the Republic of Palau. The curr_chunk defines "Agreement" and "Compact of Free Association" and discusses the results of the Compact Review. The Agreement and appendices signed by the United States and the Republic of Palau on September 3, 2010 are approved, with the exception of the extension of article X regarding Federal Programs and Services. The Agreement signed between the United States and the Republic of Palau on September 3, 2010 is approved, with the exception of the extension of article X regarding Federal Programs and Services. If Palau withdraws more than $5,000,000 from the trust fund in fiscal years 2011, 2012, or 2013, certain payments under the Agreement will be withheld until the withdrawn amounts are reimbursed. The Republic of Palau must reimburse the trust fund for amounts exceeding $5,000,000 in fiscal years 2011, 2012, or 2013. The Secretary of the Treasury will transfer necessary funds to the Secretary of the Interior for implementing specific sections of the Agreement. Authorization for appropriations is provided. The Secretary of the Interior is authorized to appropriate $1,500,000 annually for postal services to Palau, Marshall Islands, and Micronesia until 2024. The Compact of Free Association authorizes funding for Federal entities to carry out responsibilities, with a repeal of a specific Act. Payment schedules and fund withholding are outlined in the Agreement. The Compact of Free Association authorizes funding for Federal entities under Section 211(f) for specific Act repeal, with outlined payment schedules and fund withholding in the Agreement. The Government of the United States will contribute $30,250,000 to the Fund as per a specified schedule. Additionally, the Agreement will be interpreted to include a grant for infrastructure maintenance. The Agreement states that the Government of the United States will provide a grant of $6,912,000 for fiscal year 2014 and $2,000,000 annually from 2015 to 2024 for an Infrastructure Maintenance Fund. The Government of the Republic of Palau will match these contributions with $150,000 quarterly. The Government of the Republic of Palau will contribute $150,000 quarterly to the Infrastructure Maintenance Fund from 2014 to 2024, in accordance with the Agreement. The Government of the Republic of Palau will contribute $150,000 quarterly to the Infrastructure Maintenance Fund from 2014 to 2024, in accordance with the Agreement. SEC. 3. FISCAL CONSOLIDATION FUND. The United States will provide Palau with $10,000,000 in fiscal year 2014 to reduce government arrears. This is in addition to the economic assistance provided in previous years. The Government of the United States will provide Palau with $69,250,000 in economic assistance over the fiscal years 2014 to 2021. The Government of the United States will provide Palau with decreasing economic assistance over fiscal years 2018 to 2023, totaling $27,250,000. Funds will be distributed quarterly for infrastructure projects. The Agreement specifies that infrastructure projects will receive funding totaling $27,250,000 over fiscal years 2018 to 2023. "Infrastructure projects will receive $27,250,000 in funding over fiscal years 2018 to 2023." The United States will provide grants totaling $40,000,000 to Palau for infrastructure projects over fiscal years 2014 to 2016. Additionally, the Compact of Free Association Amendments Act of 2003 has been amended to extend programs and laws until 2024. "Passport requirement under SEC. 141." Any person in certain categories may be admitted to the US without regard to specific sections of the Immigration and Nationality Act, as long as they have a valid machine-readable passport. This includes individuals who were citizens of the Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands on September 30, 1994. Individuals eligible for admission to the US without specific immigration requirements include those who were citizens of the Trust Territory of the Pacific Islands on September 30, 1994, and have become citizens of Palau, those who acquire Palauan citizenship at birth after the Constitution of Palau's effective date, and naturalized citizens of Palau who have resided in Palau for at least five years post-naturalization with a certificate of actual residence. Individuals who have become citizens of Palau and have resided there for at least five years post-naturalization with a certificate of actual residence are permitted to accept employment in the United States. Their right to establish habitual residence in a US territory or possession may be subject to non-discriminatory limitations outlined in US or territory regulations. Section 141(a) does not grant a citizen of Palau the right to establish residence for naturalization under the Immigration and Nationality Act or petition for benefits for alien relatives. However, it does not prevent a citizen of Palau from acquiring such rights or lawful permanent resident alien status in the United States.
